revised_title: Kinetics and Mechanism of Ammonia Synthesis on Doubly Promoted Iron Catalysts
tldr: The authors studied the reaction rate of ammonia synthesis on doubly promoted iron catalysts using stoichiometric mixtures of nitrogen and hydrogen or deuterium. They found that the rate-determining step is the chemisorption of nitrogen on a surface mainly covered with NH radicals. This discovery challenges the commonly accepted mechanism of ammonia synthesis and opens new perspectives for further research.
